attributes.action: SUPPORT THE RESIDENTS OF BRODIE AVENUE, LIVERPOOL IN ASKING THE PLANNING INSPECTORATE TO REFUSE THE APPEAL BY VODAFONE UK TO INSTALL A TELEPHONE MAST ON A FABULOUS TREE LINED AVENUE IN SOUTH LIVERPOOL
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
WE THE RESIDENTS OF MOSSLEY HILL HAVE FAUGHT THE CONSTANT APPLICATIONS BY VODAFONE UK OVER THE LAST 2 YEARS TO INSTALL A 13.5M MONOPOLE MAST WITH 3 ANTENNAS AND 2 EQUIPMENT CABINS ON THE CENTRAL RESERVATION OF BRODIE AVENUE, LIVERPOOL 19.THEIR LAST APPLICATION IN MAY 2007 WAS REFUSED BY THE LOCAL PLANNING COMMITTEE AND HAS NOW GONE TO APPEAL IN BRISTOL IN JANUARY 2008. 
WE ASK FOR SUPPORT AS THIS MAST WILL BE AN OBSTRUCTION TO MOTORISTS WHERE IT WILL BE ERECTED AND WILL ALSO DAMAGE THE HEALTH OF TREES ON THIS FINE AVENUE (AND ITS RESIDENTS AND USERS). WE ALSO BELIEVE THAT THE ASSOCIATED CABINS WILL ALSO RAISE THE LEVEL OF ASB IN THE AREA.

rejection.details: The excessive use of capital letters makes this petition hard to read on a computer screen.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
